abstract.p: Dr Brendan R Flynn letter comments on May 16 article on left-handedness

block.p: I teach organic chemistry, in which the concept of the handedness of molecules, or chirality, is of fundamental importance. I am also one of those adults whose manual preference was changed as a child, with some of the typical effects like poor coordination. Hence, I follow this subject with great interest.

I teach organic chemistry, in which the concept of the handedness of molecules, or chirality, is of fundamental importance. I am also one of those adults whose manual preference was changed as a child, with some of the typical effects like poor coordination. Hence, I follow this subject with great interest.

When I introduce chirality in my classes, I always poll students from other countries as to what words are used in their languages to describe left versus right hands. In all the cases to date, the words associated with left-handedness are rather unflattering and uncomplimentary.
DR . BRENDAN R. FLYNN Binghamton, N.Y.
